gui

Class GGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.GGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GAnimation, GUIComponent

    public class GGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements GUIComponent, GAnimation
    Created by Robert on 4/30/17. This class draws a simple graph of a supplied data array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GGraph(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> dataPoints)
      Creates a graph with the supplied data points.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int draw(java.awt.Graphics g, int x, int y, int width)
      Draw the elements for this object every frame.
      void updateAnimations()
      This method is called after elements are drawn and is used to update variables associated with animations.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GGraph

        public GGraph(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> dataPoints)
        Creates a graph with the supplied data points.
        Parameters:
        dataPoints - The lines of the graph. Each element of the outer ArrayList is a x point of the graph while each element of the double array is the y value of a line on the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public int draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                int x,
                int y,
                int width)
        Description copied from interface: GUIComponent
        Draw the elements for this object every frame.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GUIComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to.
        x - The x origin of this object.
        y - The y origin of this object.
        width - The width of this object.
        Returns:
        The height of this object.
